title: Wantaway Everton star Romelu Lukaku hints their lack of ambition is behind his refusal to sign new deal
text:

I am not saying names, but they are doing well" Share Lukaku will put pen to paper somewhere this summer — but it's not likely to be at Everton (Photo: Everton FC/Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Romelu Lukaku has claimed his contract U-turn is down to Everton ’s lack of ambition. 
Striker Lukaku now looks certain to leave the Goodison Park side in the summer - with a host of the world’s top clubs set for a bidding war over him - even though Toffees chiefs thought a deal was done as late as Tuesday evening. 
And Lukaku, the Premier League’s current top scorer, has turned his back on a £110,000-a-week contract because he believes he must move on if he is to earn himself a world-wide reputation. 
He said: “Everton as a football club has a great history, but the future has to be written, you get me? 
"Instead of living in the past, you have to think ahead. You want to be remembered by winning trophies, at the end of the day. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Why clubs want to sign Everton's Romelu Lukaku Share this video Watch Next 
"We always talk about the [Everton] teams of the 1980s and 1970s and it was great, but we we want the fans talking about now. No disrespect, but you want to remembered as well. 
“You have to think how this club has to grow, how it has to improve, which player does it want to bring in so you can challenge for the big trophies. 
“I don’t know what the board’s plan is, but there were some players I knew the club could have got and they didn’t, and they’re playing in this league. 
"I am not saying names, but they are doing well.” 
Lukaku, is still only 23 and has two years left to run on his current contract. But with the likes of Real Madrid, Chelsea, Paris Saint-Germain and Manchester United in the running to sign him, there is no chance Everton can keep him. 
He said: “I look at Luis Suarez, Roberto Lewandowski, Karim Benzema, Edinson Cavani. That’s it. Barcelona star Suarez is one of the few strikers Lukaku feels he can learn from (Photo: Getty) 
"I’m not looking at the rest. No chance. 
“He [Tottenham's Harry Kane] is a top player and you want to see top players in the league, but I don’t look at other players if they aren’t going to teach me anything. If I don’t have the feeling that you are going to teach me something, why should I look at you? 
“I watch what they do in certain moments and I think, 'That’s interesting.' I’m close to that [level], I’m close. 
"At the minute, I am one of the best strikers in the league. I can’t NOT say that. If I don’t say I am one of the best I am shooting myself in the head. At the minute I am one of the best in the Premier League, 100 per cent. Lukaku appeared at a Kick it Out event hosted by Everton on Wednesday... (Photo: Everton FC/Getty) ...but after three prolific years with the club's famous badge on his shirt... (Photo: Everton FC/Getty) ...he seems sure to be in another club's line-up photos next season (Photo: Everton FC/Getty) 
“But at the end of the day fans want to see trophies, players want trophies. So we need to try more, give a bit more. You should not shy away from it. 
“Like, if you don’t win a trophy there is something that has gone wrong, because if you have the belief that you can do something, you can do it.” 
* Romelu Lukaku is one of Kick It Out’s Next 20 ambassadors and was speaking at a coaching session with Everton in the Community’s girls pan-disability team . Like us on Facebook
